alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 2:01AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in southern New Jersey...Burlington, Camden, and Gloucester. In southeast Pennsylvania...Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Pitman, Palmyra, and Magnolia. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 3 and 4. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 18...and between mile markers 24 and 25. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 23 and 37. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 42 and 44. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
